intro: Miricacalia peltifolia, commonly known as the velvetleaf pellucid. It is a flowering plant native to Central and South America, characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in shaded undergrowth. Its foliage is covered in fine, soft hairs, giving it a velvety texture.
